newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa trading fault due to electricity problems.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa trading fault due to electricity problems.

text.p: The halt to trading on South Africa's Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE) has been caused by problems with the electricity supply, a JSE spokeswoman said,
Trading on the JET equities system halted around 0900 GMT.
"The trading system has not gone down. We are having trouble with the electricity. Whether it is a power failure or a power surge we don't know," the spokeswoman said.
She added that all the phones and personal computers in the building had also been hit, but that back up generators were now providing some power.
There was no indication of when the trading system might come back on again, but the spokeswoman said a statement would be issued as soon as more details emerged.
The all-share index was last at 6,958.8, down 136.0 points, and the industrials index was off 169.4 points to 8,170.0. The golds index was off 10.7 points to 1,290.9.
